title: A man walks 5 km toward south and then turns to the right. After walking 3 km he turns to the left and walks 5 km. Now in which direction is he from the starting place? - Quora

response.answer_text: A man walks 5 km toward south and then turns to the right. After walking 3 km he turns to the left and walks 5 km. Now in which direction is he from the starting place? Friends…! The Man walks 5 km towards South means,he faces towards south and his back is towards North. After walking 5 km now he turns to right means now he is moving 3 kilometer, facing towards West Direction and his back is towards east. Next after walking 3 kilometer, the man turns towards left means, again he is facing south direction and his back is towards north. He is walking 5 km towards south direction. The man is now in South direction from the original start point. Approx 13 kilometer south west of original position. Answer : The man is now in SOUTH DIRECTION, exactly south west from the original start point.

The Man Walking Towards Southward means the hindside is North. Turning to right means now the Man moves towards West Direction and the Man now turns towards left means the direction is South Direction. The SOUTH DIRECTION. THE Man makes two Right angled Triangles from the Original Position, each sides are 5 Kms, and 3 Kms. Respectively.
